intro: Cyclosorus rubrinervis, commonly known as the red-veined water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, floating fronds that are typically 10–30 cm in length. The fronds are divided into small, linear segments with a distinctive red vein pattern running through them. This plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, often found in marshes and ponds. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
